qas.question: Which mountain is a holy pilgrimage for both Hindus and Tibetans?
Who do Hindus believe lives in Mount Kailash?
What is the Tibetan name for Mount Kailash?
Which lake is the largest in China?
What mountain is a holy site for Hindus and Indus?
Who do the Tibetans consider Mount Kailash to be the abode of?
What is the Hindu name for Mt. Kailash?
What are the Hindu words for high-altitude lakes?

context: The Indus and Brahmaputra rivers originate from a lake (Tib: Tso Mapham) in Western Tibet, near <a0_0><b4_0>Mount Kailash<b4_0/><a0_0/>. The mountain is a holy pilgrimage site for both Hindus and Tibetans. The Hindus consider the mountain to be the abode of <a1_0><b5_0>Lord Shiva<b5_0/><a1_0/>. The Tibetan name for Mt. Kailash is <a2_0><b6_0>Khang Rinpoche<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Tibet has numerous high-altitude lakes referred to in Tibetan as <b7_0>tso or co<b7_0/>. These include Qinghai Lake, Lake Manasarovar, Namtso, Pangong Tso, Yamdrok Lake, Siling Co, Lhamo La-tso, Lumajangdong Co, Lake Puma Yumco, Lake Paiku, Lake Rakshastal, Dagze Co and Dong Co. The <a3_0>Qinghai Lake<a3_0/> (Koko Nor) is the largest lake in the People's Republic of China.
